meanings.definition: Gaths: a plural form of gath, a Hebrew measure of weight
meanings.sent1: The merchant measured the spices using gaths.
meanings.sent2: The farmer sold his wheat by the gaths.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly used gaths instead of grams in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him weighed more than a thousand gaths.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was filled with gaths of gold.

meanings.definition: Gaths: third person singular present of gath, to go or move
meanings.sent1: She gaths to the market every morning.
meanings.sent2: The train gaths swiftly along the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The cat gaths lazily across the room.
meanings.sent4: Time gaths forward, never looking back.
meanings.sent5: The river gaths peacefully towards the sea.
